containermanagerd(8) System Manager's Manual containermanagerd(8)

NAME

containermanagerd —
Application and plug-in containerization management daemon

SYNOPSIS

containermanagerd [--runmode runmode] [--default-user username] [--bundle-container-mode mode] [--bundle-container-owner username] [--system-container-mode mode]

DESCRIPTION

containermanagerd creates, destroys, and otherwise manages containers for applications and their respective plug-ins and works in concert with sandbox(7) to provide application containerization. It is a classic launch daemon and/or agent managed by launchd.

The following arguments are available:

--runmode runmode
Defines the running mode of the daemon where runmode is one of the following:
exclusive
The daemon will run in exclusive mode where all containers on the system are managed by a single containermanagerd process. This is the default runmode. This mode can only be run as a LaunchDaemon.
agent
The daemon will run in per-user mode, and will manage containers only for the current user.
proxy
The daemon will run in per-user mode, but will only forward messages to the LaunchDaemon. This mode will automatically be used if set to run as an agent but the current user has no home directory, or its home directory is /var/empty.
--default-user username
Sets the default user where user data will be stored.
--bundle-container-mode mode
Controls how bundle containers are managed where mode is one of the following:
none
Bundle containers will not be supported.
global
Bundle containers will be cross-user and owned by the system.
per-user
Bundle containers will be per-user and owned by the user.
--bundle-container-owner username
Sets the username that bundle containers will be chown(2) to. Ignored if bundle container mode is not global
--system-container-mode mode
Controls how system containers are managed where mode is one of the following:
none
System containers will not be supported.
global
System containers will be cross-user and owned by the system.
per-user
System containers will be per-user and owned by the user.
--system-container-owner username
Sets the username that system containers will be chown(2) to. Ignored if system container mode is not global

Users should not run containermanagerd manually and changing arguments is unsupported.

FILES

  • /System/Library/LaunchDaemons/com.apple.containermanagerd.plist
  • /System/Library/LaunchAgents/com.apple.containermanagerd.plist
  • /usr/libexec/containermanagerd
  • ~/Library/ContainerManager
  • ~/Library/Caches/com.apple.containermanagerd
  • ~/Library/Containers
  • ~/Library/Group Containers

SEE ALSO

xpc(3) sandbox(7)

HISTORY

containermanagerd was first introduced in macOS 10.16.
September 4, 2019 Darwin
